column1: JINYA Ramen Bar - Houston////The portion was just enough to fill you up. There are plenty of noodles
column2: but the noodle to meat ratio is off. There are plenty of noodles
column3: but only 2 pork chashu and 1 egg. The broth is not too heavy
column4: but does have a meaty/porky flavor. I like that the broth is soupy and not too thick. The garlic oil and garlic chips didn't serve much purpose because I didn't taste any. The best part of the whole bowl was the egg. It was perfectly cooked
column5: juicy and runny and so flavorful. Most of the ingredients worked well together and was so filling and delicious.
